lexUnit.name: quarrel.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an angry argument or disagreement.

sentence.text: At the small Wintoun Street Baptist Chapel in Leeds, for example, quarrels over finance and personalities raged for twenty-five years.
Even if you just use them as memory joggers, they could prove invaluable if there is ever a quarrel about who actually said what and when .
A game of football had started below and the familiar quarrels of sportsmen were already floating up to me.
A psychologist, Professor H. C. Dawe, investigated the quarrels of pre-school American children during the morning free-play period at nursery school.
Quarrels among the older children lasted longer than those among the younger.
Quarrels between brothers and sisters provide the ideal training-ground to carry out this kind of teaching.
There were bitter quarrels between Valerie and me .
Others , terrified of intimacy and closeness, use quarrels as a means of maintaining distance.
They had had a bitter, sniping quarrel in the hall, because Sara had said that she needed her car.
The quarrel of the Italian government with the papacy nearly led to an anticlerical league of governments around about 1880.
Bismarck hoped this would enable him to avoid an Austro-Russian quarrel by showing that the implicit assignment of Bulgaria to a Russian sphere of influence still held good.
People Howard has never heard of pick quarrels and pass out.
This is the story of a quarrel over women involving a series of abductions and retributions which culminate in Paris's kidnapping of Helen.
The servants in the house say he and his mother have some dreadful quarrels about his ways .
Indeed, he is said to have been beside himself with rage and looking to pick a violent quarrel with anyone who happened along.
A warrior in the service of Cesare Borgia, he was stabbed to death in 1501 in a quarrel with another man over possession of a fancy Spanish shirt .
New Zealand's quarrel with France over the Rainbow Warrior incident was formally ended when a French naval ship docked at Auckland for the first time in almost six years.
After the quarrel with his family , he had a nervous collapse.
I 've never had a quarrel with him in my life. "
